generatedBlock.settingsPanel.title: Dynamic-element settings
generatedBlock.previewPanel.doubleClickM: Double click to set content from the Modules
generatedBlock.settingsPanel.block.libra: Simply drag-n-drop the blocks from the Library to the proper section of dynamic object and specify the rules of how exactly those blocks should be filled in with the data from your datasource.
The list of supported rules can be found
generatedBlock.previewEditor.startSectio: Here you specify what module should go at the very beginning of your dynamic element.
generatedBlock.previewEditor.repeatableS: Here you specify what modules should be included in a cycle (loop) and set respective rules.
generatedBlock.previewEditor.tailSection: Here you specify what module/modules should go at the very bottom of your dynamic element if some items still remain in the data source after the cycles, specified above, have been completed.
settingsPanel.generatedBlock.rules.hasVa: Apply only if a specified field is present in the data source
settingsPanel.generatedBlock.rules.hasNo: Apply only if a value of the specified field in the data source is not empty
settingsPanel.generatedBlock.rules.hasSp: Apply only to the fields in the data source with specified values
settingsPanel.generatedBlock.rules.recor: Apply only if there is a specified number of records left in the data source
settingsPanel.generatedBlock.rules.total: Apply only if the number of records is even
Apply only if the number of records is odd
settingsPanel.generatedBlock.rules.onlyO: Apply only to a specified cycle (loop)
settingsPanel.generatedBlock.rules.every: Apply only to cycles with a value that is multiple of a certain number
settingsPanel.generatedBlock.rules.start: Apply to all cycles starting from a specified one
nifty.explanation:
Block "Timer" is developed and provided with the support of third-party service niftyimages.com solely for the purpose of review.

We will be able to guarantee the quality of the work of the "Timer" block only when registering a paid subscription, which will be possible in the beginning of this autumn.

adaptContainersControl.label: Responsive structure
adaptContainersControl.explanation.on: Containers of the structure will be located one below the other on mobile devices.
adaptContainersControl.explanation.off: Containers of the structure will be located in one row on mobile devices. This can lead to incorrect display when content with a large width (large words, etc.).

The element will be included in both MIME versions of the email: to classic HTML and AMPHTML.

appearance.control.buttonOutlook.descrip: This option ensures the most accurate display of your buttons in MS Outlook email clients by inserting a special VML-code element. When this option is activated, the email size can be increased up to kilobyte for each added button.
settingsPanel.blockLibrary.synchronizabl: Changes made to this module will be applied to all templates / emails where this module has been used with the synchronization option activated
call.support: Please contact the support to get the details.
synchronizableModuleControl.label: Synchronized module
synchronizableModuleControl.description: Whenever you make changes to this module (and update it), these changes will be automatically applied to all other templates / emails where you used this synchronizable module
synchronizableModuleControl.update.descr: Current changes will be saved in the library and applied to all templates with this module
synchronizableModuleControl.restore.desc: Module content will be restored from the library
synchronizableModuleControl.unbind.descr: Save changes only in this template, breaking the link with the library
